moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: The Sicilian Defense, Fischer's favorite counter to P-K4.
moves.8. Qf3 Qc7 9. O-O-O Nbd7 10. g4 b5: Gligorich's K-side aims are countered by Fischer's ambitions on the Q side.
moves.11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. f5 Ne5: Fischer seizes the opportunity to plant his Knight on a central outpost.
moves.13. Qh3 O-O: With the players castled on opposite wings. they can both attack with abandon.
moves.14. Nce2 Kh8 15. Nf4: Now Gligorich plants his own Knight on a strong outpost.
moves.15... Rg8 16. Rg1 d5: 16... Q-N2 was the more solid but less active alternative.
moves.17. fxe6 dxe4 18. Nd5 Qc5: Both sides have chances. 19 N-B5 QxR 20 N(B5)xB BxP 21 NxR BxP leads to wild complications.
moves.19. Nxe7: Gligorich avoids the wild complications and settles for winning back the minor exchange.
moves.22. Rd6 Nxg4 23. Rxg4: Avoiding 23 RxQ? NxQ! winning a piece outright.
moves.23... Qxf5: 24 R-B4 holds the draw. Instead, Gligorich blunders.
moves.24. Rxg8+: Handing Fischer an opportunity to win. 24... KxR! is the winning move.
moves.24... Rxg8: Now Gligorich again has good drawing chances.
moves.25. Rxf6 Qd5 26. Rd6 Qf5 27. Rf6: Here Fischer could play for a draw by threefold repetition [27...Q-Q4 28 R-Q6 Q-KB4 29 R-KB6 Q-Q4]. Instead, he tries for a win.
moves.27... Qg5+ 28. Qxg5 Rxg5 29. Rxf7 Bg4 30: A draw could easily have been agreed, as material is even and Black's advantage of the lone passed Pawn is not enough to force a win. But Fischer and Gligorich play on.
moves.31. Ke3 Rg1 32. Bh3 Re1+ 33. Kf4 Bd1: Fischer attempts to squeeze out a win that isn't there.
Now it is Gligorich who has the material advantage! Fischer can still hold the draw with 37...P-K7.
moves.37... Bg4 38. Bxg4 Rxg4: The position simplifies a little more.
moves.39. Rc3 e2 40. Re3 Rg2: With the conclusion of 40 moves, both players were relieved of any time-pressure.
moves.41. Kd4 e1=Q 42. Rxe1 Rxc2 43. Rb1: Setting a trap: 43...RxRP? 44 K-B5! invading the Q-side decisively.
moves.43... Kf7: Fischer doesn't fall for it. He tries to centralize his King.
moves.44. a3 Ke6 45. b3 Rxh2: Fischer vaporizes the passed KRP now that it is safe to do so.
moves.46. Kc5 Kd7 47. Kb6: Gligorich threatens to massacre Fischer's Q-side Pawns.
moves.47... Ra2 48. Kxa6 Rxa3+: 49 KxP is now answered by 49...K-B2 with an easy draw,
moves.49. Kb7 Kd6 50. Kb6 Kd7 51. b4 Rh3 52. R: 52...R-R4 holds the draw [53 R-B5 RxR 54 KxR K-B2 55 KxP K-N2 with the Opposition.]
moves.52... Rh8: A terrible blunder by Fischer, allowing Gligorich a chance to seize the win. 53 R-B7 ch!! wins, as Fischer's King can no longer get in front of the Pawn.
moves.53. Kxb5: Gligorich fails to seize the chance. Now Fischer takes the opportunity to draw the game.
moves.55. Kb3 Rc8 56. Rxc8 Kxc8 57. Kc4 Kb8: Drawn. Fischer holds the distant Opposition.
